newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelan oil basket rises $0.51 in wk to $17.58.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelan oil basket rises $0.51 in wk to $17.58.

text.p: The average export price for Venezuela's basket of oil crudes and products rose $0.51 over the past week to $17.58, figures from the Ministry of Energy and Mines showed.
It was the third consecutive week's rise.
Venezuela's basket price for May so far was $16.83 per barrel, the Ministry said, almost 20 percent below its peak at the beginning of the year, but over a dollar above the April average.
The basket price peaked in January with an average of $20.36 per barrel, having closed 1996 with one of the highest average prices for several years at $18.39 per barrel.

Venezuela's government, which gleans some 50 percent of its revenues from oil, has based its 1997 budget on an average price for the year of $14.40 per barrel, although Energy and Mines Minister Erwin Arrieta has said he expects it to average higher than $15.50.
